picks.text: Two new iPad Pros
picks.full-pick-text: Two new iPad Pros
picks.notes:
• "Maybe more of a hope"
  • As it turns out, there would later be a separate event for the iPad.

picks.text: A new Smart Keyboard
picks.full-pick-text: A new Smart Keyboard

picks.text: iWork updates for iOS 12
picks.full-pick-text: iWork updates for iOS 12
picks.notes:
• A week after grading, there is some controversy from the listeners and Federico, as iWork did get updated (well, slightly, a few basic Shortcut actions were added), it just wasn't mentioned in the keynote. Stephen proposes a placating half point, but Myke stands firm that "there are no half points around here." This seems to be the last time that half points were ever considered for a pick.
  • The big iWork update eventually came in 2019.

picks.notes:
• Exact names weren't the main goal of this pick. The pick intended to convey that the existing iPhone X would drop from the lineup, but both sizes of 8 and 7 would stick around.
  • The SE being dropped as well wasn't enough to make the pick wrong, apparently.

picks.full-pick-text: iPhone 9 will come in colors

picks.full-pick-text: New pencil and keyboard

picks.full-pick-text: The cheaper iPhone will be called iPhone 9

picks.full-pick-text: The only iPhones seen on stage will be the ones we already know about
picks.notes: • This seems to have been a sub-bullet point to the previous pick originally, but was forcibly upgraded to a full pick by Myke during grading. (Again, this "game" wasn't even supposed to be a competition originally.)

picks.full-pick-text: New and faster FaceID

relevant-episodes.title: Connected #208: It's Ugly and I Want It

picks.text: AirPods to gain more controls via touch actions
picks.full-pick-text: AirPods to gain more controls via touch actions

picks.text: At least 1 more color option comes to AirPods
picks.full-pick-text: At least 1 more color option comes to AirPods

picks.text: The AirPods line is split in two, and the lower end version gets a price drop
picks.full-pick-text: The AirPods line is split in two, and the lower end version gets a price drop
picks.notes:
• The additional condition is an intentionally risky choice by Federico
  • Ultimately this is in fact his undoing. While AirPods Pro were released to split the line, the normal AirPods 2 didn't drop from their original $159 price until the 3rd generation was released in October 2021.

picks.text: The next HomePod is a mini HomePod
picks.full-pick-text: The next HomePod is a mini HomePod
picks.notes: • True, but too late. The HomePod mini wasn't released until 2020.

picks.text: HomePod price drop
picks.full-pick-text: HomePod price drop
picks.notes: • In April, they were cut from $349 to $299.

picks.text: Shortcuts will gain new HomePod/AirPlay 2 actions to play audio on HomePod more quickly
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts will gain new HomePod/AirPlay 2 actions to play audio on HomePod more quickly

picks.text: Apple will create some new noise-cancelling technology
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will create some new noise-cancelling technology
picks.notes:
• Some sort of thing that they put into an AirPod or something that they tout as invented by Apple, is how it was clarified during predictions.
  • Myke, in absentia, gets the benefit of the doubt as to how new the AirPods Pro tech is.

picks.text: Better incorporation of Apple News into the audio ecosystem
picks.full-pick-text: Better incorporation of Apple News into the audio ecosystem
picks.notes:
• For example, asking Siri for the news on a HomePod
  • This did eventually happen, but in 2020.

picks.text: Changes to rules about apps being installed from alternate sources
picks.full-pick-text: Changes to rules about apps being installed from alternate sources
picks.notes: • Specifically, that users no longer need to reinstall an application to get it from a different app marketplace.
